title: Retrieving closure signature causes panic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I have been trying to write a compiler plugin which, at some point, has to retrieve the signature of a closure. There seems to be a recommended way of doing it, described [here](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/4717cf2fcbde585d81c47417b1fb921572a3c537/src/librustc_typeck/collect.rs#L1576), but calling this function [as described](https://github.com/FabianWolff/rustc-cl-sig-mwe/blob/ce9b269bcc8701d9e4cd26bd69cd5ff77868f462/src/bin/cl-mwe.rs#L49) leads to a panic: ``` error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_middle/ty/sty.rs:419:18: closure_sig_as_fn_ptr_ty is not a fn-ptr: Param(/#1) ``` From my understanding, the issue stems from [here](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/4717cf2fcbde585d81c47417b1fb921572a3c537/src/librustc_typeck/collect.rs#L1420), where "junk" is created instead of the actual signature, but of course I might be wrong. ### Code A minimal working example for the plugin side is [here](https://github.com/FabianWolff/rustc-cl-sig-mwe); the input code might look like this: ```Rust fn main() { |_a: i32, _b: i32| {}; } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.47.0-nightly (7e6d6e5f5 2020-08-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7e6d6e5f535321c2223f044caba16f97b825009c commit-date: 2020-08-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.47.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_middle/ty/sty.rs:419:18: closure_sig_as_fn_ptr_ty is not a fn-ptr: Param(/#1) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:918:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.47.0-nightly (7e6d6e5f5 2020-08-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ```
